content.title: Financial Assistance for Coaching Classes (HBOCWWB)
content.details: The scheme 'Financial Assistance for Coaching Classes' is implemented by the Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB). Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹20,000/- is provided for coaching classes for admission of children of registered workers in professional/technical courses like Degree/Diploma in Medical, Engineering, Management, MCA, Law, Fashion design, etc., and ₹1,00,000/- for preparation of Main Examination on passing Preliminary Examination of UPSC/HPSSC.
benefits: Financial assistance of ₹20,000/- for coaching classes for admission of children of registered workers in professional/technical courses.
₹1,00,000/- for preparation of Main Examination upon passing the Preliminary Examination of UPSC/HPSSC.
eligibility: The applicant should be engaged in building or construction work.
The applicant should be registered with the Haryana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.
The registered worker must have a minimum of one year’s regular membership.
The worker must have an active membership with the Board.
The son/daughter of the worker should be receiving coaching for admission in professional/technical courses from an institute.
The worker should not have applied again for financial assistance for the coaching of his/her child. The assistance will be provided only once.

The spouse of the worker should not have received any financial assistance for coaching classes of his/her child from any government department/board/corporate institution, nor should they have applied for such assistance.
Financial assistance for coaching will be given up to three children.
content.application_process: Online application process through the official website of the Labour Department Haryana.
documents_required: Identity proof i.e. Aadhaar Card, Voter Card

faqs.question: How much financial assistance is provided for coaching classes?
faqs.answer: ₹20,000/- is provided for coaching classes for admission of children of registered workers.

faqs.question: What financial assistance is available upon passing the Preliminary Examination of UPSC/HPSSC?
faqs.answer: Individuals are eligible for ₹1,00,000/- to prepare for the Main Examination.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: All registered workers who have completed one year of membership with the Haryana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board are eligible to apply.

faqs.question: Is there a limit to the number of children eligible for financial assistance?
faqs.answer: Financial assistance for coaching will be given for up to three children of the registered worker.

faqs.question: Can workers reapply for financial assistance for coaching of their child?
faqs.answer: No, financial assistance will be provided only once for each child.

faqs.question: Are there any restrictions on the spouse of the worker regarding financial assistance?
faqs.answer: The spouse of the worker should not have received any financial assistance for coaching of their children from any government department/board/corporate institution.

faqs.question: How can a construction worker register under HBOCWWB?
faqs.answer: The construction worker should visit the Official Website of the Labour Department Haryana to complete the registration process.

faqs.question: What is the application process for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Visit the Official Website of the Labour Department Haryana to apply for the scheme.

faqs.question: Which professional/technical courses are covered under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Courses such as medical, engineering, management, MCA, law, fashion designing, etc., are covered.

faqs.question: What is the condition regarding the membership duration of registered workers?
faqs.answer: Registered workers must have a regular membership of at least one year to be eligible for the scheme.
